Reviews.Title: “Smelly room, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ievag1
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else. The room was dated and smelled of cigarettes and cigars. It is by no means a four star hotel it claims to be. The breakfast was just plain terrible! There is bread bread and more bread....nothing else. The location is ok, and there is a good restaurant just up the hill, but still, I think something better can be found in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay for an easy walk to the historic center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld012
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of blocks off Via Cavour (major artery to historic area) in a quieter not so touristy area. The hotel clerk was very helpful and accomodating. The room price was E-80, a larger room with private tiled bathroom. The room view from the 4th floor was very nice, looking out over the two intersecting streets. We took the metro subway and exited at -Cavour, two blocks walk to the hotel. The breakfast (included with the room) was large varied and tasty, the coffee superb. They also have a nice outdoor restaurant with shady arbor where we ate when we arrived. The food was excellent! The room comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in October”
Reviews.Author: susbellquig
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in Rome. We had a fabulous time and just loved Rome. Hotel is a perfect base to see all the sights. Staff could not be more pleasant and helpful. Pleasantly surprised at the cost of food and drink. Ate twice at the resturant just up the hill next to the hotel on a recommendation from the reception staff. Gave us a card and we got 10% off the bill. It was fabulous and at the end they just sat the shots bottle down and we helped ourselves. Lovely food and reasonably priced. Antonio the night porter was fun and we enjoyed his slightly "eccentric" sense of humour. Breakfast was basic but fresh and was enough to get us started on our trips. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Second year in a row with Ivanhoe. Great!”
Reviews.Author: LMayEatery
Reviews.Content: This year we brought a small tour group to stay. The staff accomodated our special requests. The hotel cleanliness, location and breakfast make this an affordable sleeping place in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Simple”
Reviews.Author: metron
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good location (Monti) which is not so touristy yet close to everything as you can walk to all the major attractions and enjoy the strolling. I walked from it as far as to Vatican City and Trastevere. Room itself is very simple and very very small, yet I only stayed in it for a sleep, so cannot complain much, Breakfast is also very basic

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Klaus20
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights in room 41 and I enjoyed it very much. The bed was comfortable, clean and the bathroom was huge. It is a basic hotel and the breakfast is simple. If you want luxury it is not for you. But the roof terrace, location are hard to beat. The staff was very friendly. I stayed in a hotel with a much higher rating in the same street before but the bed was too uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “POSSIBILY THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN”
Reviews.Author: Maxwellgoc
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably bad. My travel Agent will get a rocket. Small room, no wardrobes, smallest bathroom and toilet I have ever seen. Shower base was absolutely a joke. When sitting on the toilet , ones knees were under the hand basin. Small double bed with a paper thin mattress. No clock, airconditioning did not work, television did not work, room alongside the lift ( noisy) and worst of all the window had to be open during the night. No room for overseas travellers with luggage. An adjacent very busy cobble stone roadway was noisy all night. Breakfast included??? No juice ( run out) no toast ( toaster broken) no COFFEE ( coffee machine broken and the the Lady had no idea of English. NEVER TO RETURN AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Experience elderly traveller from overseas

Reviews.Title: “Very Small but ... Great, great, great!!!”
Reviews.Author: kapuchok
Reviews.Content: + Fantastic location (Close to Coliseo, Forum, Palatin, Trevi Fountain...) + Great Staff. + Next to Cavour Metro Station. + Lots of restaurants and bars around. + Clean and well equiped rooms. (Rooms were small, especially the shower) - Bathroom shower was NOT, NOT, NOT great.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a 5....”
Reviews.Author: invisibulman
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Easy walk to Colleseum and right next to the Metro. Much cheaper than comparable hotels in the area. Room was on the smallish side, but adequate. Here is why I give it a 4 instead of a 5... I am a rather svelt 5' 10" 140lbs, I was unable to bend over at the sink with the bathroom door closed... I'm not sure I could turn a full 360 degrees in the shower without bumping into a wall.. and my knees hit the sink while sitting on the toilet... I know the small hotel bathroom is a European thing, but come on. This was just silly. We managed, but I dread to think how a larger individual would function with such a crampt WC.

Reviews.Title: “Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: cyberasylum
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with the best location you can have in Rome. Close to Coliseo, Forum, Palatin, Trevi Fountain, and so on with pretty quiet surroundings (not easy to find in Rome). Lots of restaurants around. Friendly staff. Clean and well equiped rooms... but as said in other reviews : very small (bathroom, bed).

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: kriisolsen
Reviews.Content: location is excellent with a lot of authentic traditional restaurants around.Furthermore, it is an asset, that the hotel lies close to the most famous tourist sights - a few steps from Colosseum and Roman Forum. Rooms are small, but very well equipped - bathroom small, but indeed satisfactory. Breakfast: you cannot ask for more in italy - even rye bread for us scandinavians. Staff extraordinarily kind and obliging . We intend to book Hotel Ivanhoe, when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good location”
Reviews.Author: KGACanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ivanhoe so that we could visit all of the sites to see in Old Rome. The hotel was very good in location, hospitality, price, and overall room size which is normally quaint in Europe anyway but unfortunately the bathroom shower was not great. if you are over 5' 7" & weigh more than 180 Lbs it will be a struggle to have either a shower or bath. My wife & I would stay there again but it would be nice if the Italians could learn how to make a MODERN shower.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: mjmcork
Reviews.Content: In some ways this hotel has a lot going for it - it is not overly expensive and it is very centrally located, plus it is just down the road from a metro station. But I wouldn't be in a hurry to return there for a few reasons 1) the place really has no character. There are plenty of hotels in Rome that feel in some way unique, or as though their building have seen plenty uses down through the years. Ivanhoe feels plastic 2) the rooms are small (not unusual for Rome) but the bathrooms are ridiculous. I am neither giant nor morbidly obese, but it was a struggle to sit confortably on the toilet, and it was impossible (I do not exaggerate) to turn around in the shower. Add to this the ineffectiveness of the shower door. Not good! 3) the breakfast was AWFUL! I don't have particularly strong feelings about the place, but I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but fairly basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mellowmist
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ivanhoe is situated in the Monti area, close to the main attractions and a very short walk from Cavour metro station, which is handy for getting to the central train/bus terminal (Termini) when you have a lot of bags. This area is hip and trendy, and much less touristy than other areas; it has an authentic feel to it, and there's lots of shade and not much traffic (this is a blessing at night - no Vespa drone!). It is full of little boutiques and restaurants, along side simpler more traditional groceries and convenience stores. The hotel itself left something to be desired. The rooms were clean enough, but small and poky. The shower was only about 2 feet square, the water temperature varied (not a problem in the very hot weather, but would have been awful at a different time of year), and the shower head kept falling off its holder. The soap and bath mat/towel weren't replaced automatically, and we couldn't get hold of an iron at all, despite learning the Italian for this and asking for it several times. We were told first that we would get one, then that it was a safety hazard and then that the iron was broken. There was air conditioning but it took a while to cool the room. There were no facilities for making tea or coffee in the room, but there was a TV and a fridge. The fridge contained cold drinks costing about 2 euros each. We filled our own water bottles and put them in the fridge to save money, but these were mistaken by staff for hotel bottles and we were charged for two bottles we did not drink. Breakfast consisted of coffee and a croissant - the only other food on offer was stale bread, packaged Melba toast, packaged rye bread, processed ham and a kind of orange squash to drink. Staff were friendly enough and helped us when asked, but we didn't feel that anyone was going overboard to be welcoming or proactive. We resorted to writing a note in Italian (cobbled together from a phrasebook!), to ask for the things we needed, and leaving it in our room for staff to find. This seemed to work! All in all, if you don't mind average accommodation and service at a reasonable price (it worked out at a little over 100 euros per night for two people), this hotel is fine, but it might be worth checking out others in this area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: theyogaattic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with friends and we stayed at Hotel Ivanhoe. This was our first visit to Rome. At first I was a little concerned by the construction going on with the adjacent building and graffiti in the area (I quickly learned many areas in Rome are covered with graffiti). To my surprise this was a great little neighborhood with lots of resturants, bars and shops. D'mitre on staff gave us great recommendations on where to go for dinner. The hotel was conveniently located a short walk from a metro. It was also within walking distance to the Colliseum and other historic sites. The hotel was small, but very modern with nice amenities. There was a round table near the bar where we were able to gather and plan our activities for the day and another small lounge next to that. Breakfast Room was charming and staff was friendly and attentive. Breakfast was plentiful - a great way to start the day. Rooms were small (especially the shower), but we did not spend much time in them since we were only there for a short time and there is so much to see and do in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MortyUK
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome to celebrate my partner's birthday, which is also the same week as Valentines. So finding a hotel was a nightmare. But after reading reviews here, I gave the Ivanhoe a try. We managed to book a room and we were not disappointed :) It is ideally located a few minutes walk from the Colosseum and Forum. All major sites are within walking distance. But, if you are feeling lazy, there is a metro station a few metres down the street. The hotel is nicely tucked away, so there is very little noise at night. The staff were very friendly and made you feel very much at home. OK the rooms were smallish, but fine for us. Plenty of storage space for clothes, a comfortable double bed and decent TV (although why would you want to watch TV when there is a fabulous city outside to explore!!!). We would happily recommend this hotel and go back ourselves. The down sides - no tea/coffee making facilities (thankfully we had taken our own travel kettle) - the smallest shower I have ever seen (although unless you were very large, it was still perfectly usable) - if you visit in the colder months, take slippers! as the tiled room floors are freezing hehe

Reviews.Title: “Very good value. Quiet but central”
Reviews.Author: cyfannedd
Reviews.Content: The staff were welcoming when we arrived, and helpful throughout. The room was compact but adequate and the bed comfortable. The hotel is well-kept and clean, and the decor good. We had no problem with the shower, although I can imagine it might be a bit cramped for a larger person. The location, in a picturesque cobbled street near the metro one stop from Termini Station, is excellent. We didn't need heating or air-conditioning as the weather was quite mild, but both were available. Even with the window slightly open, there was very little noise from the street at night. Just one criticism: the breakfast would have been better if there had been some cheese in addition to the jams and honey; on the other hand there was cereal which one doesn't always find in small European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: B0DAI
Reviews.Content: I had decided to whisk my new girlfriend away to Rome for New Years. She had never been to Rome before, and I was hoping to make it an unforgettable, romantic experience! I am a very keen traveller, and so have learnt the hard way that it is always best to check hotel reviews on the internet before booking anywhere. Seeing that this hotel had better than average reviews, and was the right price for my budget, I booked a double room there. I must say that thanks to this hotel, our first 2 days in Rome were DEFINITELY not romantic. In fact, I would describe the experience I had at this hotel as HORRIFIC and totally unacceptable. You can be rest-assured that I will be going on to EVERY travel site I can find and relaying my experience of your hotel to anyone and everyone and recommending that they stay ANYWHERE but your hotel. My girlfriend and I checked in on Thursday 31st December 2009. We asked to book a taxi to take us to the restaurant where we were to spend the New Year celebrations, but were told that this was unnecessary, and to just come down to reception when we were ready... I was a bit dubious about this, but bowed to (what I thought was) their superior knowledge of the Roman taxi service. The first thing we noticed was that the room was MOST DEFINITELY not as advertised on the website... It was almost ridiculously small, with the furniture only just fitting in. Clearly not the spacious room that was shown in the photos on the website! There was paint peeling off the walls and the room was certainly not as clean as I'd have expected! I am actually very surprised that the hotel staff aren't embarrassed to even show these rooms to potential guests if they all look like that. Having had a long journey to Rome, we just decided to make the best of the situation. However, when we came to get ready to go out for New Year's Eve celebrations, I went to have a shower and found that there was no hot water!! I went to complain and was told to wait 20 minutes, so I returned to my room. 20 minutes later... STILL no hot water. I returned to the desk to complain and the man there went to run some water, and finally agreed that there was no hot water (AS IF I WAS LYING!!). He went up into the attic to check the tanks and asked me to watch the desk (!!). When he returned he said that the tanks were fine, so I should wait for longer!! We waited another 30 minutes, but were getting close to our reservation time at the restaurant so had to go out without showering properly!!! We came to reception to ask for a taxi, and (surprise surprise) the receptionist could not get through to a taxi firm! He told us to wait, causing me to have to call the restaurant to change our reservation!! Eventually, we told him to forget it and just walked out, hailing a taxi on the way. When we got back, we got almost no sleep because the window in the room was literally right on a road where people were walking up and down and shouting until early in the morning (I appreciate that this, at least, is out of the hotel's control, but include it to demonstrate what a terrible experience I had in your hotel)! The next day, we got up to find that there was STILL NO HOT WATER!! I went to reception to complain, and YET AGAIN, had to spend a long time trying to convince the receptionist and the maids that I was not, in fact, lying and that there was no hot water! Again, we had to go out without properly showering! I decided that there was NO WAY I was going to allow my girlfriend to spend another night in this disgrace of a hotel. As such, we found another hotel that had the BASIC AMENITIES that this hotel clearly struggles with. We returned to the hotel and I told the receptionist that we were checking out because I was disgusted with the room and the lack of hot water. He shrugged as if he didn't care at all... Although he did give a grudging apology. While I was there, other guests came in to complain about the hot water and were told that it would be fixed hopefully in a couple of hours!!!! Then I was told that I had to pay the full amount for staying in the hotel even though I was checking out after only one night (of the 3 nights booked) there!! He did, however, say "We won't charge you for what you have used from the mini-bar though" (we didn't even use the mini bar!!), as if this was something I should be very grateful for!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: mumandgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights - we were initially thrown by the outer renovation work, but when inside it didn't disturb us at all. The staff were brilliant - we had left our passports in our previous hotel in Sperlonga, and the receptionist signed us in using our driving licences as ID and then phoned the previous hotel and arranged for them to be brought to The Ivanhoe for us - she really couldn't have been more helpful. All the staff were notably pleasant. Yes, the room was small, but it was comfortable and the air conditioning was excellent. The bathroom, particularly the shower, was tiny but also spotlessly clean with fantastic water pressure. The Ivanhoe is in a fantastic location - just along from a metro stop, near a wide variety of cafes and restaurants and a short stroll away from the Colosseum. Its on a side street and is lovely and peaceful at night - no traffic noise at all. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful, and service was good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service, great location, tiny hotel under repair”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravelfiend_9
Reviews.Content: The Ivanhoe can't be beat for the location, and an inexpensive place to stay in Rome. The Front desk staff is extremely nice and very helpful. However, the rooms are tiny and cramped. After a long day of walking around Rome, the rock hard bed left a lot to be desired and walking into walls in the middle of the night is to be expected since there is little room around the bed. Taking a shower is a challenge due to the fact it is built to the proportions of a lilliputian. When we arrived the whole front of the hotel was covered with scafolding, and the construction cranked up by 9 am in the morning. An excellent choice if you won't be in your room very much, otherwise you might be stressed out by the spartan quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PADK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a mini break in Rome in time to watch the UEFA championship. Although we were greatly saddened that our team did not win, we were delighted by the fact that Rome is such a beautiful city. Very interesting. It seemed that people through the years have molded their modern lives around the ancient structures of the city- very well preserved. Now to review Hotel Ivanhoe, I would recommend this gem of a hotel to visitors of Rome. It is very good value for money. Europe is an old civilisation and unless you are staying in the outskirts of oldie worldie city, you will not find modern building structures/ hotels anyway. What is the point of paying an arm and a leg for an old building to sleep in when you can use that money for many other holiday treats. Hotel Ivanhoe's interiors has had a thorough re-furbed in the last 2 years. The rooms, common areas and hallway are all looking polished and new. The linens and towels still have the fresh feel to them. The room we had on the 4th floor was a good size. I like the way they have the wardrobes hanging on the wall, hence, freeing more floor space. The bathroom looked clean and modern. No moldy presence that you find in old hotels. Ok, the shower cubicle is on the small size. My husband and I are average to smallish size and we did not find it impossible to fit in the shower cubicle. However, for super size visotors, it can border challenging to maybe impossible. Hmmm, I recommend walking all around Rome to be able to fit in the shower cubicle then :). At present the hotel is covered in scaffolding which frightened me upon our arrival. However, a lady coming out of the hotel very calmly assured me it is not bad as it looks. Indeed, once inside the hotel, there were no sign or sound of construction apart from very muttered noise mid day. But hey, we were long out and about exploring in the day time. Surely the hotel's exterior works will be done and ready by this summer time. Location- superb. From airport, take train to Termini central station, costs 11 euros. At termini, keep underground and walk towards the bus terminal where you will find the metro line. Take line Blue line B heading towards Laurentina. Metro cost is 1 euro. Alight on the first stop- CAVOUR. When you get over ground, you'll be on Via Cavour. Look for the other Metro Sign (right in front of you - this is the opposite Metro direction) and cross the road. Down the steps into Via Urbana. turn right and 30 m to your left is Hotel Ivanhoe. it has a caffe with outdoor seatings on a platform atatched right outside the hotel's foyer. The reception staff we have met were all friendly and spoke many languages. Eleonor from the reception gave us a perfect instruction to get to the Vatican on the day of our arrival and stored our suitcases for us (as we have arrived early before check-in time). We have found Al fresco restaurants and cafe/bars close by. Explore and you'll be pleasantly surprised by what is around the hotels. We were fascinated by the LIbrerias everywhere that doubles up as drinking bars/clubs at night. You can walk the whole of Rome and find a historical site at every turn. Close to the hotel is the Colosseum, Forum, Campidoglio, Vittorio Emmanuelle Mounument. Just across Cavour is the San Pitro in Vincoli which has the shackles of St. Peter and the marble statue of Moses. Of course, walk towards Termini and you'll find Santa maria de Maggiore. A must to Rome visitor, take the Metro to the Spanish Steps, enjoy the scenery. We found a bar on the left hand side of the steps (as you go up) with spectacular view. Down at the bottom of the steps, walk via Condotti and enjoy the posh designers name, even if you only do window shopping. Walk along Via Corsa to Trevi Fountain and then head to the Panteon. This shuts at 5 pm. The Panteon faces a lovely quaint Piazza with lots of al fresco restaurants. You must dine here and take a photo with the Pantheon behind you. Tables are lit with candles by 8 pm and buskers of world class talent performs in the Piazza. Food and wine is good and what more, the atmosphere will make your dining experience magical. No one is in a hurry dining in Rome. Take your time, stay as long as you please. The vatican tour is a whole day affair. It only costs 8 euros to get in Vatican Museum and free to go in St. Peter's Basilica, but missing the queue is worth the 40 euros you pay the tour guide touted just as you alight the Metro at Ottaviano. The guides are well informed and makes your appreciation of the art work and history present more enjoyable. That's all for now. Arriverdeci! PADK

Reviews.Title: “When I entered our room, once again, I knew God exists.”
Reviews.Author: olalaoparis
Reviews.Content: Rome was the last segment of our European trip and we wanted it to be perfect so we booked at another hotel called la Picola Maison and it was disaster :( it was so noisy and hot. They did not allow us to turn on the AC. At least they were nice to let us move to another hotel. I went to an internet cafe and selected Ivanhoe, it did not have great comments on TA but it had great reviews on Venere. I followed my instints. What could be worst at this time? I called them and they had a room for us. We walked from Via Veneto to the Ivanhoe. It was almost half the money of what we were paying at the other one, it was safe, quiet, and beautiful. Now I underestand why most people call it a little gem. The location is excellent, at walking distance to everything in the ancient city. We took a taxi to the vatican and it was only 7 euros. With the money we saved we were able to get a taxi to the airport (40 euros) They have a full time staff that made us feel at home. Yes, the shower was small but I was ok with it. The room was extremely clean and decorated with good taste and everythink looked new. The breakfast was the best that we had in the whole european trip. The girls up front were so nice and informative. The romms are not extremely big but this is standard in europe. The rooms had every thing you need. I highly recommend this hotel and feel free to contact me with questions. The highlights of our trip: getting the air tickets at Expedia, flying Paris to Venize on easyjet and finding Ivanhoe hotel. Ivanhoe saved our Rome stay and this is another hotel that should be in the top ten Rome hotels. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great area, wouldn't have guessed this was a 2-star.”
Reviews.Author: eastwood0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me through a mate for a good quality budget hotel. Although I wasn't going to be too fussy being in Rome for one night, the place was a lot better than I expected and I have stayed in a lot less appealing hotels calling themselves 3 star or higher. The room and decor was immaculate and in fact all the areas of the hotel including the lobby and breakfast room were very polished and professional with a very pleasant staff on hand too. I felt really comfortable here and considering the place has a roof garden to enjoy drinks (for a 2 star hotel!?) and is right within the action, two minutes from Cavour Metro station and very close to the Coloseum and Roman Forum, this place was a real 'find' and I was delighted with it. I'm not going to tell you it's luxurious and has all the trappings of wealth but for a budget hotel? Get on it!

Reviews.Title: “Overall word: TINY/SMALL but ok”
Reviews.Author: Dutchees
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Villa Pamphili (see my other review) me and my husband for business, we moved hotel for our privat stay at Rome. We were adviced this hotel by a travel agent. Due to lack of time I was not able to check this site for reviews, but...below my findings. The hotel is the 3-star rating worth. Eventhough everything is extremely small (especially the shower, which caused many laughs by us) it was all clean, simpel and it was all there. shower, toilet, sink, bed, closet, tv etc... However...it was very noisy so hard to sleep. Also the TV does not really work and has none of the international networks on. Also NO internet in the rooms. Futhermore breakfast is a joke. You only get from everything 1. (1 croissant, 2 slices of bread with only jam, 1 drink and coffee) so if you are a big eater...then this definetely won't do. Furthermore the people were very helpful and friendly. Also the hotel has a very nice Cafeterria where we hang out and had our extra breakfast :-) .....however they close at 8 pm...so you can't hang here. Location is perfect, walking distance from the Colleseum and the Forum! But...i won't stay here again. It was all ok...but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you value taking showers or baths!!!”
Reviews.Author: thomaabi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and just a few blocks from the Colosseum and a metro station. When I say small I mean really small. I'm a 6'2" american weighing in at 220lbs and my main problem with this hotel is it's bath rooms - they are literally water closets. I first stayed in a room with a tub - probably 3 shoulder widths by two shoulder widths (you'll soon see why I use shoulder widths for measurement-the kind the tailer would measure and nothing extra). BUT this tub had a hug graduated step right in the middle of it. I think it was meant for you to take a shower while sitting down. I dreamt the same night on my rock hard bed and thin slice of pillow that I would die in the same bathroom having accidently slipped. The next day I switched rooms and got a regular shower with a rigid sliding curtain. Now this one was 1.5 shoulder widths long by 1 shoulder width wide. The water handle control was right where my tummy was and I had to make sure I didn't breathe in deeply or I would shut off the water! To lather up I had to turn off the water, open the rigid curtain and turn around. For 160 euros a night I find myself in the shower adventure of a lifetime. On a positive note they provide breakfast in the morning but all it is is dry croissant, bread, toast, and whatever coffee you like. (The coffee in Italy is awesome, and applies here also). If I wasn't staying with family I'd check into a hostel or maybe re-budget and get a better place. This place isn't for big people like me or even people half my size - you really have to be a midget to enjoy this place.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ivanhoe
HotelInfo.Address: Via de Ciancaleoni 49 - Via Urbana 50, 00184 Rome, Italy
